wikipedia_page.main:
Frank James Clarke (born 15 July 1942) is the eldest of five brothers who all played in the Football League.
After playing non-league football for Willenhall Town, he played in the Football League as a centre forward for Shrewsbury Town, Queens Park Rangers, Ipswich Town, and Carlisle United.His younger brothers Allan, Derek, Kelvin and Wayne all played in the Football League, and Frank is the only one of the five who did not represent Walsall.

response: Clarke spent two seasons at Gay Meadow having previously had a successful loan period at the club several years earlier. Clarke joined Shrewsbury from Walsall on the eve of The 1993–94 season. Clarke had a successful season finishing second top scorer with 18 goals, helping to bring the Division Three title and promotion to Division Two. Clarke was the youngest brother of Frank Clarke whom had also played for Shrewsbury Town as a striker. The club released him at the end of the 1994–95 season, he had scored 22 goals in 59 games.
Frank Clarke is the name of:
* Frank Clarke (British politician) (1886–1938), British Conservative politician, MP for Dartford
* Frank Clarke (American football) (1934–2018), America football player
* Frank Clarke (footballer) (born 1942), English football player (Shrewsbury Town, QPR, Ipswich Town and Carlisle United)
* Frank Clarke (triathlete), Canadian triathlete in 1992 ITU Triathlon World Championships
* Frank Clarke (pilot) (1898–1948), Hollywood stunt pilot for Associated Motion Picture Pilots
* Frank Clarke (editor), British film editor of Lock Up Your Daughters
* Frank Clarke (judge) (born 1951), Irish former Supreme Court judge
